Shows just how cheap and easily damaged those grills are on the GMC Truck. The grill breaking away is probably what saved the owls life. Softened the blow of getting hit by the truck.

replies.context: They are actually " break away grills" engineered to save horned owls.
Hecho de Mexico

Most vehicles today have simple plastic grills, think of it this way it is weight reduction, the less it weighs the better the fuel mileage. A 2020 C1500 can get as much as 22 hwy in some models, 50 years ago a C10 would average 8 to 12 at best.

"Cheap" may not be the proper term you are looking for. If the grill didn't break so easily, you'd probably be looking at much more expensive repairs to other items around that area of the vehicle. 

Also; if you are so worried about your grill, maybe you should stop driving 15MPH over the posted speed limit. Driving the posted speed limit would cause less damage when you hit something.

You obviously didn't have any outdoor cats or small dogs back then. Great Horned Owls have been known to take both.
Should Stacey be worried if she  goes out for a walk?

As true as it is, it's very rare. Most owls would rather feast on small rodents. Even if Owls do occasionally take a small pet; that doesn't mean we should feel animosity towards the owls - they are only trying to survive. By the way; eagles also sometimes do this, but again - it's rare.

Lost 2 young cats to them several years ago when I lived in Western New York State. Like any Predator, they will take what they can get. They are magnificent animals but you need to be aware if you have small pets that like to go outside, especially at night.

How do you know it was owls?  I'm genuinely curious, I'm not suggesting it wasn't. Lots of critters around at night. Racoons will kill pets at night as well. Rats, Cougars (or other wild cats), Geese, even your neighbors cats will kill rival cats in the neighborhood. I've even witnessed an Opossum (defending her young) take down a neighborhood cat.
